summary: This document appears to be an email chain from November 2019 discussing allegations against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It contains descriptions from a New York Times article and a more detailed account of inappropriate touching and sexual advances by Epstein, often with Maxwell's involvement, during movie outings and at a property in New Mexico.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as initiating inappropriate physical contact (rubbing hand, leg, foot) with a woman during a movie outing and engaging in other sexual advances at a property in New Mexico, sometimes with Ghislaine Maxwell present.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Allegedly participated in or facilitated inappropriate activities, including giving the woman a nude massage, being present during foot massages and sexual advances by Epstein, and providing instructions on how Epstein liked foot massages.

persons.name: Mike Baker
persons.context: Appears as a recipient or sender in the email chain discussing the allegations; the context suggests they are sharing or analyzing the victim's account.

persons.name: Brad Pitt
persons.context: Mentioned only as the star of the movie "12 Monkeys" that Epstein and the woman went to see; no direct involvement in the allegations.

connections.description: Allegedly acted together during incidents of sexual abuse and harassment, with Maxwell facilitating massages and being present during Epstein's advances.
Maxwell is described as giving instructions on how to perform foot massages "how Epstein likes it," suggesting a subordinate or facilitating role.
Epstein is alleged to have rubbed her hand, leg, and foot during a movie, climbed into bed spooning and touching her, and created a fear of rape.
Maxwell allegedly gave the woman a nude massage, was present during sexual advances, and participated in inappropriate touching.

events.title: Movie Theater Incident in NYC
events.description: Epstein took a woman to see the movie "12 Monkeys" in New York City and during the film rubbed her hand, lower leg, and foot, causing her discomfort and confusion.

events.title: Incidents at New Mexico Property
events.description: At a property in New Mexico, Epstein and Maxwell engaged in multiple inappropriate acts including foot massages, Epstein climbing into bed spooning and touching the woman, Maxwell giving her a nude massage, and a joint incident where both started touching her, leading her to run away afraid of rape.

events.title: Email Discussion of Allegations
events.description: An email chain discusses and summarizes allegations against Epstein and Maxwell, referencing a New York Times article and providing a detailed victim account.

keyFacts: A woman alleges Jeffrey Epstein rubbed her hand, leg, and foot during a movie outing to see "12 Monkeys" in New York City, causing her confusion and discomfort.
At a property in New Mexico, Ghislaine Maxwell gave the woman instructions on how to perform foot massages "how Epstein likes it."
Epstein allegedly climbed into bed with the woman, spooning and touching her, while Maxwell gave her a nude massage with Epstein present.
During an incident in New Mexico with both Epstein and Maxwell, the woman became afraid of rape and ran away.
The document references nude photos of the woman going missing and comments being made about her features.
